newsitem.title: AUSTRIA: Austrian Airlines set to raise air fares.
newsitem.headline: Austrian Airlines set to raise air fares.

text.p: Austrian Airlines are likely to raise air fares later this week in response to higher jet fuel costs, following similar moves by other European airlines, Austrian newsagency APA reported on Wednesday.
"I can't imagine that we would want to swallow the extra costs ourselves," chief executive Herbert Bammer was quoted as saying. He added a decision would be taken on Thursday.
Austrian Air competitor Lauda Air Luftfahrt AG last week said it would raise ticket prices for scheduled flights by four percent from November 1.
KLM Royal Dutch Airlines and British Airlines also have announced that thwould hike air fares after kerosene prices have risen by as much as 50 percent over the past year.
